18 #define MAX_TIMER_SEC 600 // time [sec] 10 minutes
19 #define TOLERANCE 0.4 // distance [m] between robots needed to be considered a successful catch
20 
21 
29 void odomCallback(const nav_msgs::Odometry::ConstPtr &odom_1_data, const nav_msgs::Odometry::ConstPtr &odom_2_data, double startTime)
30 {
31  //ROS_INFO("Both Odoms synced!");
32  double x1, y1, x2, y2;
33  x1 = odom_1_data->pose.pose.position.x;
34  y1 = odom_1_data->pose.pose.position.y;
35  x2 = odom_2_data->pose.pose.position.x;
36  y2 = odom_2_data->pose.pose.position.y;
37 
38  //std::cout << "Odom 1 pose: \tx: " << x1 << "\ty: " << y1 << std::endl;
39  //std::cout << "Odom 2 pose: \tx: " << x2 << "\ty: " << y2 << std::endl;
40 
41  //checks if robots are touching
42  if((x2-TOLERANCE < x1 && x1 < x2+TOLERANCE) && (y2-TOLERANCE < y1 && y1 < y2+TOLERANCE))
43  {
44  std::cout << "\n\nRobot got chatched!" << std::endl;
45  std::cout << "Robot got chatched!" << std::endl;
46  std::cout << "Robot got chatched!\n\n" << std::endl;
47 
48  //writes the time into a file
49  std::string path = ros::package::getPath("gruppe5");
50  std::string filepath = path + "/Time_Table";
51  std::ofstream log(filepath.c_str(), std::ios_base::app | std::ios_base::out);
52  double elapsedTime = ros::Time::now().toSec() - startTime;
53  double secs = ros::Time::now().toSec();
54  std::cout << "Time: " << elapsedTime << std::endl;
55  log << elapsedTime << "\t caught" << "\n";
56 
57  ros::shutdown();
58  }
59 }
60 
66 void timerCallback(const ros::TimerEvent &event, double startTime)
67 {
68  std::cout << "\n\nTimer expired!!" << std::endl;
69  std::string path = ros::package::getPath("gruppe5");
70  std::string filepath = path + "/Time_Table";
71  std::ofstream log(filepath.c_str(), std::ios_base::app | std::ios_base::out);
72  double elapsedTime = ros::Time::now().toSec() - startTime;
73  double secs = ros::Time::now().toSec();
74 
75  std::cout << "Time: " << elapsedTime << std::endl;
76  log << elapsedTime << "\tTimer ran out" << "\n";
77 
78  ros::shutdown();
79 }

92 int main(int argc, char **argv)
93 {
94  ros::init(argc, argv, "timer_node");
95  ros::NodeHandle nh("~");
96 
97  // https://stackoverflow.com/questions/45309584/error-using-boostbind-for-subscribe-callback/45311193#45311193
98  double startTime = ros::Time::now().toSec();
99  ros::Timer timer = nh.createTimer(ros::Duration(MAX_TIMER_SEC), boost::bind(timerCallback, _1, startTime));
100 
101  //https://answers.ros.org/question/280856/synchronizer-with-approximate-time-policy-in-a-class-c/
102  message_filters::Subscriber<nav_msgs::Odometry> sub1;
103  message_filters::Subscriber<nav_msgs::Odometry> sub2;
104  typedef message_filters::sync_policies::ApproximateTime<nav_msgs::Odometry, nav_msgs::Odometry> MySyncPolicy;
105  typedef message_filters::Synchronizer<MySyncPolicy> Sync;
106  boost::shared_ptr<Sync> sync;
107 
108  sub1.subscribe(nh, "odom1_sub", 1);
109  sub2.subscribe(nh, "odom2_sub", 1);
110 
111  sync.reset(new Sync(MySyncPolicy(10), sub1, sub2));
112  sync->registerCallback(boost::bind(&odomCallback, _1, _2, startTime));
113 
114  ros::spin();
115 
116  return 0;
117 }
